page.title: 15The Llandudno Tram.
page.content: {The TRAM STATION}is in Church Walks and runs up Old Road, Ty Gwyn Road and Killen's Hill to Half-way Station. It then continues up the {Great Orme}to the summit. The system is split into two at Half-way, where the engine room is situated. The tram runs every 20 minutes in season (May to Oct) from 9 am to 6 pm. From Victoria Station, Church Walks, to Half-way takes 5.5 mins, and 4.5 mins from there to the summit. The two halves work different -ly - the engine at Half-way pulls up the bottom tram and lowers another tram from Half-way on the same cable, which is wrapped round a huge wheel; on the top half, the tram coming down from the summit pulls up the tram from Half-way on an almost continuous cable. In 1984, 119,780 people were carried. It is a great tourist attraction.
